answers.answer: Calcium magnesium is something you can take to help. There aren't any negative effects and it won't cure preclamp but it helps with your BP. I take 1000mg a day 500 in the morning and 500 evening.

Eat a low sodium high protein diet. And rest a lot!I have pre-eclampsia and am on modified bed rest. Have been hospitalized 4 times already since I was about 23 weeks, I am 34+5 now. It has started affecting my baby, so I see the Dr weekly now in case they feel my son has to rather be delivered. I am on 6 tablets daily.Oh also drink lots of water!Good luck!
5Nov... How has it affected your baby? What effects can preeclampsia have on babies, in general?

Ive had a sudden onset of preeclampsia. Very high blood pressure and protein levels. Had to have emergency csection at 28 weeks.It affected my baby too. High BP slowed blood supply to placenta so baby was barely growing for 2 last weeks.You lucky you are far along now. Just follow all doctor's instructions, REST, and monitor your BP.Good luck, mama!!

I'm not sure exactly how to answer your questions but I do know that it's life threatning. My mom had it with my brother. She had to get an emergency  c section and he was born 6 weeks early. He had to stay in nicu  for over a month. They cough it to late and they both almost died. So please be careful and do whatever the dr says so you have a safe rest of your pregnancy .

Laat week my Dr said my baby has started to loose weight instead of gaining. Seeing him again tomorrow to see if it has changed and to find out whether I will be having a csection or be induced.It affects the blood supply to the baby via your placenta, and can cause premature birth and low birth weight.I have also heard it can cause baby to have seizures inside the womb, but have fortunately not experienced that.It is life threatening though, so it is very important to do as your Dr says!Good luck ladies!

My son was born a little under 3 weeks early due to preeclampsia. I went in for my 37 week check up and my blood pressure was high (which it had never been in prior appointments) and I was leaking proteins in my urine (also never had occurred). They sent me to the hospital and ran a few blood tests prior to admitting me. Because I was 37 weeks, they induced me but ended up having to have a c-section because I wasn't dilating. My son was born the next day.The worry with preeclampsia is that your blood pressure could get too high and you could have a stroke. The only "cure" is having the baby be delivered.

question: So today I went to the Dr. I have protein in my urine (2 weeks in a row) my blood pressure is up and I have been dizzy with headaches...the Dr ordered labs, and is making me do a 24 hr urine catch.....I am 36w+5....my question is this...what exactly is toxemia or pre eclampsia? And what are the worries ....and what if anything can I do to help myself and my child......
title: pre-eclampsia?
